intro: Crinum brachyandrum, commonly known as the short-stalked crinum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, strap-like leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters at the top of the stem. It is typically found in wetlands or along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Crinum brachyandrum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively hardy in tropical and subtropical climates.
